title: Upgrade to Android Studio 2. Issue reported by @tomjohnson1492
message:
Upgrade to Android Studio 2. Issue reported by @tomjohnson1492

Previously, if you opened one of the projects in Android Studio 2, you
would get a gradle error:

    Error:Gradle version 2.10 is required. Current version is 2.2.1.
    If using the gradle wrapper, try editing the distributionUrl in
    .../gradle-wrapper.properties to gradle-2.10-all.zip
    Fix Gradle wrapper and re-import project
    Gradle settings

This change fixes the gradle wrapper to use version 2.10.

title: Added an open source license
message: Added an open source license

title: Changed a layout text size from dp to sp.
message: Changed a layout text size from dp to sp.

title: Fix rotation bug in the workout app reported by j8s0n.
message:
Fix rotation bug in the workout app reported by j8s0n.

Previously, the back button in the workout app would not work
correctly if there were multiple items in the back stack. The code was
erroneously creating transactions and storing state in the
=onCreateView= method, rather than in =onCreate=.

title: Fix bug that left the odometer service running.
message:
Fix bug that left the odometer service running.

The bound odometer service previously kept running when the associated
activity closed. The change no stops the service when the app is left.

title: Corrected issue that hid action bar icons.
message:
Corrected issue that hid action bar icons.

There was previously a problem with the `BitsAndPizzas` app which
meant that icons could disappear from the action bar, leaving only
text menus. This change corrects the namespace used in the
`main_menu.xml` file.

title: Source code for chapter 14: Material Design.
message:
Source code for chapter 14: Material Design.

We make one more set of amendments to the BitsAndPizzas app.
This time we convert the interface to use RecyclerViews and
CardViews.

title: Renamed the folders so that they will appear in numeric sequence.
message: Renamed the folders so that they will appear in numeric sequence.

title: Added code for chapter 13.
message:
Added code for chapter 13.

In this chapter we're looking at services. We'll build two apps:

- An intent service that tells a joke
- A bound service that measures distance traveled

These are examples of the two major types of service.

title: Added a link.
message: Added a link.

title: Code for chapter12: Cursors and AsyncTasks.
message:
Code for chapter12: Cursors and AsyncTasks.

In this chapter we wire up the interface to the database code we
created in chapter 11. We'll look at how to use cursors to read data,
how to reset cursors to keep the data fresh, and how to use
+AsyncTasks+ to prevent your app from sloowwwinnnngggg
dooooowwwwwnnnnn...

title: Create code for chapter 11: SQLite databases.
message:
Create code for chapter 11: SQLite databases.

In this chapter we start to add database support to the Starbuzz app
we created in chapter 6. We'll look at how to create a database, how
to upgrade its structure, and how to insert data.

title: Source code for chapter10.
message:
Source code for chapter10.

In this chapter we update the +BitsAndPizzas+ app to include a
navigation drawer. That means we'll need to break our interface into
fragments that represent the major *navigation hubs* in the app. The
navigation hubs are the lists that represent the major categories.

title: Added code for the BitsAndPizzas code in chapter 9.
message:
Added code for the BitsAndPizzas code in chapter 9.

In this chapter we look at the different ways you can create action
bars, and how you add custom and standard buttons to them.

title: Added code for chapter 8.
message:
Added code for chapter 8.

In this chapter we update the Workout app we created in chapter 7 to
include a nested stopwatch fragment.

title: Added a link to chapter 7 source code.
message: Added a link to chapter 7 source code.

title: Code for chapter 7.
message:
Code for chapter 7.

In this chapter we create a workout app that uses fragments to create
different interfaces for tablets and phones.

title: Added a link to the latest app in the README

title: Added code for chapter 6: Starbuzz.
message:
Added code for chapter 6: Starbuzz.

In this app we look at how to structure an app, using the three-level
architecture:

- A top-level activity for the launch activity
- A category activity to display a list of items
- A detail/edit activity to show a single item
